title: Implement evaluated case elimination
body:
Implement evaluated case elimination: when HPT proves a value is already evaluated (not a thunk), eliminate the redundant `eval` call.

**Deliverables:**
- When a `case (eval x)` scrutinises a value that HPT shows can only be constructor nodes (C-tags, never F-tags), replace `eval x` with `fetch x` (skip thunk forcing)
- When a variable is known to already hold a value (not a pointer), eliminate the fetch entirely
- Unit tests showing the optimisation applies correctly

**Design notes:**
- This is one of GRIN's most impactful optimisations — removing unnecessary eval calls
- Correctness depends on HPT accuracy
- Reference: Boquist thesis, Section 5.3
